items.content_html:
Web Text Analysis Based on Dianping.com: A Comparative Study of the Visitor Experience in UCCA Center for Contemporary Art before and after COVID-19

尤伦斯当代艺术中心疫情前后观众体验的对比研究——基于大众点评网的网络文本分析

Ullens Center for Contemporary Art 

Analyzing Platform - Voyant Tool

Data Collection - Dianping.com

Time scale - Before and After December 2019

 

Abstract: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, museums have been closed frequently, encountering problems such as loss of audience and financial crisis. In the turbulent post-pandemic era, how to deal with changes and what aspects need to be improved have become the main problems they face. Taking UCCA Center for Contemporary Art as an example, this paper uses web text analysis from audience comments on Dianping.com, combined with UCCA’s goal to analyze its micro-strategy, transformation of strategies, and the effects of transformation. Moreover, this paper reveals the changes in visitors’ focus and remaining problems of UCCA before and after the pandemic. The results show that before COVID-19, UCCA used a more economical membership mechanism to establish close relationships with audiences, which made the complaints of high-price tickets less. During that time, the audience focused on the content of exhibitions, however, after COVID-19, the demands of audiences became more abstract and they tend to talk about their feelings and emotions generated from exhibitions. Meanwhile, UCCA switched its exhibition themes to be more related to the times and people so as to communicate with the audience more deeply. In a word, although some problems still remain, such as the impolite attitude of security guards, UCCA keeps curating inclusive and non-esoteric exhibitions to attract more people, which is their goal.

Keywords: museum experience; visitor studies; art institutions; web text analysis; strategy evaluation
